intro: Faramea pachyantha var. mandiocana, commonly known as the Brazilian wax tree, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its woody structure and glossy, dark green leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink, which bloom in the spring. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
